definition: lit. without wind there cannot be waves (idiom); there must be a reason/no smoke without fire

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: She must have done that sort of thing. Where there’s smoke there’s fire.
sentences.chinese: 無風不起浪，我想她肯定做過那種事。

sentences.english: But the voters might not. They would say where there's smoke there's fire.
sentences.chinese: 但選民不一定懂得，他們會說無風不起浪。

sentences.english: Where there is smoke, there is fire.
sentences.chinese: 有煙就有火，無風不起浪。

definition: having given away a bride, to lose one's army on top of it (idiom)/to suffer a double loss after trying to trick the enemy
pinyin: pei2 le5 fu1 ren2 you4 zhe2 bing1

definition: to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
the guilty party files the suit/the thief cries thief
When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
see 驢唇不對馬嘴|驴唇不对马嘴[lu:2 chun2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3]
pinyin: niu2 tou2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3
